solution_line_template: First figure out how much water all the pigs need: {num_pigs} pigs * {pig_water_needed_per_pig} gallons/pig = <<{num_pigs}*{pig_water_needed_per_pig}={total_pig_water}>>{total_pig_water} gallons

Then figure out how much water one horse needs by multiplying a pig's needs by {horse_water_multiplier_from_pig}: {pig_water_needed_per_pig} gallons * {horse_water_multiplier_from_pig} = <<{pig_water_needed_per_pig}*{horse_water_multiplier_from_pig}={water_per_horse}>>{water_per_horse} gallons
Now find how much water all the horses need: {num_horses} horses * {water_per_horse} gallons/horse = <<{num_horses}*{water_per_horse}={total_horse_water}>>{total_horse_water} gallons

Finally, add up all the animals' water needs: {total_pig_water} gallons + {total_horse_water} gallons + {chicken_tank_gallons} gallons = <<{total_pig_water}+{total_horse_water}+{chicken_tank_gallons}={total_water_needed}>>{total_water_needed} gallons
